## partitionBy() function

Transducer. Applies given `fn` to each incoming value and collects values until the return value of the `fn` has changed. Once this happens yields chunk of buffered values.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function partitionBy<T>(fn: Fn<T, any> | (() => Fn<T, any>), stateful?: boolean): Transducer<T, T[]>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  fn | <code>Fn&lt;T, any&gt; &#124; (() =&gt; Fn&lt;T, any&gt;)</code> |  |
|  stateful | <code>boolean</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Transducer<T, T[]>`

## Example


```ts
[...partitionBy((x) => x & 1, [1, 2, 4, 6, 3, 5, 8, 4])]
// [ [ 1 ], [ 2, 4, 6 ], [ 3, 5 ], [ 8, 4 ] ]

```
